channel.title: News - South China Morning Post
channel.description: All the latest breaking news from Hong Kong, China and around the world

item.title: South Korea miners trapped for 9 days survived on instant coffee powder
item.description: Two men who endured being deep underground for 9 days after mine collapse ate coffee powder and drank water that fell from the ceiling.
item.dc:creator: Business Insider
item.author: Business Insider

item.title: Indian firm paying British PM Sunak’s wife US$13 million a year still operating in Russia despite Ukraine war: report
item.description: Infosys is owned by Rishi Sunak’s billionaire father-in-law, with US$13 million a year in dividends going to Akshata Murty, Sunak’s wife; IT company said in March it was leaving Russia but still has staffed office and is paying two subcontractors.
item.dc:creator: Business Insider
item.author: Business Insider

item.title: How German leader Olaf Scholz walked a fine line in China
item.description: The visit by the German leader was a good first step on the road to resolving some differences but it didn’t clear doubts in Europe, analysts say.
item.dc:creator: Kawala Xie
item.author: Kawala Xie

item.title: China will ‘hold fast’ to zero-Covid, as central health officials cite winter surge fears
item.description: Practice has proved that China’s Covid-control strategy is ‘completely correct’, health official says, while promising to adapt measures to changes in the virus.
item.dc:creator: Holly Chik
item.author: Holly Chik

item.title: ‘We need to rebel’: climate change needs radical response, says XR activist ahead of COP27
item.description: Extinction Rebellion (XR) co-founder Gail Bradbrook says bold action, inspiration and acting together is needed to deal with climate change.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: British police say immigration centre attack motivated by terrorist ideology
item.description: Meanwhile, reports emerged of a disturbance at a London immigration centre; Britain is struggling to cope with thousands of recently arrived migrants.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Chinese top brass say PLA must be on ‘full-time standby’ for war in Taiwan Strait
item.description: People’s Liberation Army urged to be “resolute” in crushing attempts at Taiwanese independence and foreign interference.
item.dc:creator: Liu Zhen
item.author: Liu Zhen

item.title: B-52 bomber deal with US hijacks Australia’s foreign policy independence
item.description: The Australian defence establishment’s military provocation of China threatens the country’s sovereignty and regional stability. The deal undermines Australia’s diplomatic efforts, and will make its air base a prime target in any US-China conflict.
item.dc:creator: Daryl Guppy
item.author: Daryl Guppy

item.title: Hong Kong Sevens: musical feast in store for fans as local bands, singers set to hit stage this weekend
item.description: Local bands The Red Stripes and the Naggin Eejits, as well as singer-songwriter Eli Zaelo are expected to perform over the weekend.
item.dc:creator: Cannix Yau
item.author: Cannix Yau

item.title: South Korea candlelight vigils mourn Halloween disaster victims
item.description: A week after the horrific crush that killed 156 people, most of them young, vigils and rallies were held to remember them amid growing anger over the tragedy.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Over 80 Rohingya detained in Myanmar after traffickers abandoned them: source
item.description: Source said group of Rohingya Muslims hoped to reach Malaysia; 2017 military crackdown forced 750,000 to flee for Bangladesh.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: China-backed revival of Teesta River, shared by Bangladesh and India, moves forward amid geopolitical concerns
item.description: Bangladesh hopes the river restoration will stabilise water flows for farming areas, but environmental concerns, questions about who benefits from development and potential objections from India still cloud the project.
item.dc:creator: Ananta Agarwal
item.author: Ananta Agarwal

item.title: Taiwan palace museum director faces calls to quit over broken Ming, Qing artefacts worth US$78 million
item.description: Items were damaged between February 2021 and May this year but matter came to light only after a KMT lawmaker received a tip-off.
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Chung
item.author: Lawrence Chung

item.title: ‘A window into perspective’- How three European missionaries viewed the fall of the Ming empire and the rise of the Qing dynasty
item.description: A new analysis of travel writings from 17th-century Europeans offers a window into the fall of the Ming empire and the rise of the Qing dynasty.
item.dc:creator: Kevin McSpadden
item.author: Kevin McSpadden

item.title: Russia restaurant fire kills 15 in historic city of Kostroma, suspect detained
item.description: Firefighter said it took 50 people and 20 fire engines to extinguish the blaze, which may have been caused by a flare gun.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Hong Kong to experience cooler weather next week, with temperature expected to drop below 20 degrees on Sunday
item.description: Cloudy weather and rain patches to continue into Sunday as temperature expected to drop to 19 degrees, weather forecaster says.
item.dc:creator: Fiona Sun
item.author: Fiona Sun

item.title: North Korea fires four ballistic missiles, hours after China, Russia verbally clash with US, allies over launches
item.description: Nation has fired a series of missiles in recent days, with the latest just hours after verbal clashes in UN between US/allies and China/Russia over launches, and amid speculation Pyongyang is preparing to resume nuclear testing.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Malaysia election 2022: countdown begins as crowded field of candidates put names forward for parliamentary seats
item.description: Crowds of supporters dressed in party colours turned out in their droves for nomination day on Saturday to support their chosen leaders – the traditional signal that Malaysia’s electoral campaign is officially under way.
item.dc:creator: Hadi Azmi,Joseph Sipalan
item.author: Hadi Azmi,Joseph Sipalan

item.title: John Lee stresses opportunities in city at high-level mainland forum ahead of Hong Kong’s early entry into free-trade pact
item.description: Chief executive says city remains ‘an advocate of free trade’ at forum in Shanghai.
item.dc:creator: Chris Lau
item.author: Chris Lau

item.title: Chinese central bank top brass Fan Yifei held for investigation by anti-corruption watchdog
item.description: Fan, 58, is under investigation for ‘suspected serious violations of discipline and law’, Central Commission for Discipline Inspection says on website.
item.dc:creator: Josephine Ma
item.author: Josephine Ma

item.title: Hong Kong No 2 official condemns Wall Street Journal’s ‘ill-intended and gravely biased’ editorial on mega financial summit
item.description: Chief Secretary Eric Chan writes to New York-based paper’s editor, saying piece is a ‘brazen demonstration of disrespect’ for financial leaders who attended.
item.dc:creator: Lilian Cheng
item.author: Lilian Cheng

item.title: ‘My dying mum cooked me one last meal’: man in China films frail, cancer-stricken mother making dinner before death and moves millions to tears
item.description: A man in China who sat and filmed his mother cooking him a final meal as she was dying from cancer trends on mainland social media, with many viewers saying it was a wonderful scene.
item.dc:creator: Alice Yan
item.author: Alice Yan

item.title: Thailand set to cross tourism target as Malaysians, Indians lead return of post-pandemic visitors
item.description: Over 1 million Malaysians and about 600,000 Indians have toured the kingdom, which is on course to surpass its goal to attract 10 million foreign visitors this year.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: Ukraine troops gird for bloody battle to retake Kherson from Russia
item.description: Were the key port city to fall in the counteroffensive, military experts said it would be a political humiliation for President Putin.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: More than 200 Hong Kong firms join import trade fair in Shanghai, hungry for expansion into mainland Chinese market
item.description: Among participating Hong Kong enterprises this year, 47 are led by the Hong Kong Trade Development Council, the government’s official exhibition organiser.
item.dc:creator: Fiona Sun
item.author: Fiona Sun

item.title: Joe Biden says Elon Musk bought a platform in Twitter that ‘spews lies’ around world
item.description: ‘There’s no editors any more. How do we expect kids to be able to understand what is at stake?’ Biden said amid concerns about tackling misinformation.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: ‘It’s not a scam’: Hong Kong university offers paid Netflix viewing - all in the name of science
item.description: Netflix in reverse: Hong Kong scientists will pay human guinea pigs to watch the popular streaming service – all in the name of science.
item.dc:creator: Kylie Knott
item.author: Kylie Knott

item.title: COP27: Hong Kong sends youthful delegation led by green activist, 23, underscoring need for young people’s voices to be heard
item.description: Blair Ho’s team, mostly in their 20s and 30s, want to make their voices heard on climate change
item.dc:creator: Ezra Cheung
item.author: Ezra Cheung

item.title: Will China’s updated women’s rights law actually help women?
item.description: Legal revisions to better protect women in China could be difficult to put into practice, according to observers.
item.dc:creator: Stella Chen
item.author: Stella Chen

item.title: Coronavirus: Hong Kong tourism, elderly care sectors urge further easing of pandemic rules; bookings open for toddler version of BioNTech jab
item.description: City will also open bookings for toddler version of BioNTech vaccine, to be available at four centres citywide.
item.dc:creator: Chris Lau,Cannix Yau
item.author: Chris Lau,Cannix Yau

item.title: Singapore hits back at Richard Branson for rejecting offer to debate death penalty
item.description: The Ministry of Home Affairs accused the British billionaire of ‘pontificating from a distant mountaintop, and then avoiding a serious discussion when challenged’
item.dc:creator: Today Online
item.author: Today Online

item.title: Elon Musk’s free speech Twitter mission enters orbit of Asia’s cyber laws, from India to Singapore
item.description: Navigating Asia’s stringent internet laws will require agility from Twitter and its new owner, observers note, at a time of stricter regulation of social media platforms
item.dc:creator: Amy Sood
item.author: Amy Sood

item.title: Hong Kong’s property developers will struggle to service their bulging debts as interest rates soar, analysts warn
item.description: As in the years from 1997 to 2003, a struggling housing market, slowing economy and surging interest rates are making the debt levels of the city’s home builders a cause for concern.
item.dc:creator: Lam Ka-sing
item.author: Lam Ka-sing

item.title: French far-right MP Gregoire de Fournas suspended for shouting ‘back to Africa’ at black lawmaker Carlos Bilongo
item.description: De Fournas denied racially targeting Bilongo, saying he was referring to a ship carrying rescued migrants in the Mediterranean.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: ‘Like braised pork for my goats’: Chinese farmer turns invasive plants into delicacy for livestock – saving on feed, removal costs
item.description: A farmer in eastern China has been hailed by local media after getting his goats to eat an invasive plant species that authorities have been calling on the public to eliminate for years.
item.dc:creator: Alice Yan
item.author: Alice Yan

item.title: Reunifying with Taiwan is only way to stop foreign invasion of island: China’s Communist Party
item.description: New book presents party’s rationale for adding ‘opposing and containing Taiwan independence’ to constitution last month.
item.dc:creator: Phoebe Zhang
item.author: Phoebe Zhang

item.title: Malaysia election: ethnic Chinese voters long for return of multiracial politics under Pakatan Harapan
item.description: Malaysian-Chinese have long felt dissatisfaction with pervasive racial policies and politics that place a premium on the interests of the Malay majority over all other citizens. A new survey shows they now want Pakatan Harapan back in power, and Anwar Ibrahim to be PM.
item.dc:creator: Hadi Azmi
item.author: Hadi Azmi

item.title: Foodpanda insists it will not change new pay calculation system despite industrial action by Hong Kong couriers
item.description: Food and grocery delivery platform stands firm despite string of strikes by unhappy couriers who claim they now earn less.
item.dc:creator: Oscar Liu
item.author: Oscar Liu

item.title: The top influencers on China’s version of TikTok are twin brothers with over 100 million followers
item.description: Twin brothers from China’s Anhui province have become the most popular influencers on Douyin, the Chinese version of TikTok, amassing more than 100 million followers for their account called the Crazy Yang Brothers.
item.dc:creator: Tracy Qu
item.author: Tracy Qu

item.title: Finland’s partying PM Sanna Marin cleared of misconduct
item.description: The premier became the subject of global headlines and local complaints after a leaked video showed her dancing with celebrities.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Amid chill in China ties, India and Taiwan look to ‘deeply engage’ in electronics, chips and green tech
item.description: Taipei economics minister on visit to New Delhi with top business leaders from island announces signing of at least 20 memorandums of understanding.
item.dc:creator: Khushboo Razdan
item.author: Khushboo Razdan

item.title: Haiti police break blockade of crucial fuel terminal
item.description: Police said officers dislodged the bandits led by Jimmy Cherizier from the Varreux oil terminal after two months.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Australia bets on facial recognition to deter problem gamblers despite concerns over rights
item.description: Despite concerns about privacy and surveillance, the tech – which uses AI to identify addicts who have asked to be barred from betting sites – will target problem gambling in a country where the addiction affects some 1 per cent of the population.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: China’s lithium hold won’t be undercut by Opec-style cartel as Argentina, Chile, Bolivia consider alliance
item.description: Argentina, Chile, and Bolivia are discussing a possible agreement on the production and pricing of lithium, although China currently controls over 60 per cent of the world’s refining capacity.
item.dc:creator: Connor Mycroft
item.author: Connor Mycroft

item.title: Why 40 years of US sanctions failed to keep Iran away from Russia
item.description: Iran has insulated its economy so well that US sanctions can do little to prevent it from supplying Russia with drones and missiles. Had the US tried to engage Iran instead, dependence on Western trade may have discouraged it from pursuing such deals.
item.dc:creator: Sameed Basha
item.author: Sameed Basha

item.title: Beijing criticises Pentagon report calling China the leading security threat to the US
item.description: US defence strategy says China poses ‘most comprehensive and serious challenge to US national security’; defence ministry says China adheres to peaceful development and safeguarding international system.
item.dc:creator: Liu Zhen
item.author: Liu Zhen

item.title: Donald Trump ally Tom Barrack acquitted of foreign agent charges
item.description: The verdict is another setback for the US Justice Department, after a suit seeking to make casino magnate Steve Wynn register as an agent of China was dismissed.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: As African continent heats up, builders use mud to create ‘breathing walls’ in homes
item.description: With climate change and rising temperatures, mud houses are regaining popularity across in Africa as the compacted soil proves more heat-resistant than concrete.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: In the Amazon a huge fish is making a comeback, amid cooperation galore
item.description: The pirarucu, the largest of 2,300 known fish species in Amazon floodplain lakes, was at risk of extinction but is flourishing thanks to intense collaboration, including indigenous and non-indigenous groups.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Twitter sacks half of staff, as Elon Musk complains of massive drop in revenue
item.description: The platform’s new billionaire boss is launching a major overhaul as many advertisers drop the troubled company.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse
